source.961bf8b7: X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.3, random_state=101)
source.9a0f3239: The missing Age values will be taken care of first. A box plot will give average age by class. This age can then be used to assign ages to passengers whose age is missing.
source.a636985d:
All passengers now have an Age value.

The Cabin column is still missing data. There is so much missing in this column, I will just drop it.
source.5fb807e5:
Now there aren't any missing values!

From here, the next step will be to deal with categorical features. Categorical features will be converted into dummy variables.
source.e691e380: From just looking at the head of the data, missing values become apparent. Looking at a heatmap will give a broader view of what data is missing.
source.fb64e7e4: Now the only missing data is in the Embarked column. Since there is so few missing, the row with the missing Embarked data can be dropped.
source.beb35f9d: Some data is missing in the Age column and a lot of data is missing in the Cabin column. These missing values will be addressed in the data cleaning section.
